isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS - HARD START / NO START DIAGNOSTICS -

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To find the cause of low ICP pressure that prevents engine starting.

svcsubproc.title: Test Procedure

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in this manual before doing this procedure.

note.para: If Diagnostic Trouble Codes were detected, correct the problems causing the DTCs before doing this test.

svcsubproc.para: 1. Set parking brake.
2. Remove engine harness connector from Engine Oil Temperature (EOT) sensor.
3. Remove EOT sensor to allow oil to pour out.
4. If oil pours out, reinstall EOT sensor and harness connector.

note.para: If oil does not pour out, the lubrication system may not be supplying enough oil to the oil reservoir. Correct the problem and reinstall EOT sensor and engine harness connector.

svcsubproc.para: 5. Crank engine. If engine does not start, continue with Step 6.

figure.caption: High pressure oil hose, ICP adapter, and ICP sensor

calloutgroup.callout1: Elbow fitting in high pressure oil manifold
ICP sensor (in high pressure oil manifold)

svcsubproc.para: 6. Disconnect high pressure oil hose from the elbow fitting in high pressure oil manifold.
7. Disconnect ICP engine harness connector from the ICP senor in the high pressure oil manifold.
8. Leave ICP sensor in high pressure oil manifold.
9. Install the ICP Adapter from the ICP Adapter / Plug Kit into the end of the high pressure hose.
10. Install extra ICP sensor into ICP Adapter. (Check for correct part number.)

note.para: If the EST is used for measuring ICP pressure, reconnect ICP engine harness connector to ICP sensor.
If EST is not available do a and b:

svcsubproc.para: a. Install breakout tee between ICP sensor and the ICP connector on the engine harness.
b. Connect (+) lead of DMM to the green terminal and the (-) lead to the black terminal of the breakout tee.
11. Crank engine and record the reading for ICP on Mechanical Diagnostics form EGED-180-2.

note.para: If the EST reading for ICP is more than 500 psi, or the DMM reading is more than 1 volt do the following ICP Leakage Test:

svcsubproc.title: ICP Leakage Test

step1.para: Remove ICP sensor and adapter plug from high pressure hose.
Remove the other end of the hose from the high pressure pump and connect an air pressure regulator to the hose.
Apply 100 psi to the oil manifold.
Inspect for leakage around the base of each fuel injector.

note.para: Some leakage from the top of the injector is normal.

step1.para: If an injector leaks, remove and inspect injector for damage or worn O-rings.
If injectors do not leak, do Key-On Engine-Off Injector Test (Test 7) with air pressure still applied.
Check oil discharge from each injector. Oil discharge should be equal. Excess oil leakage indicates defective fuel injectors.
To find injector leaks, remove air supply and regulator from the high pressure hose and follow the procedure below.

step2.para: Connect an automotive cylinder leak tester to the high pressure hose and apply air pressure from the cylinder leak tester.
Do an Injector Key-On Engine-Off Injector Test (Test 7) to determine the percent of cylinder leakage for each actuated injector. Remove and inspect injectors showing the most leakage.
If none of the injectors have excessive leakage, remove all injectors. Inspect all O-rings for wear and damage. Replace faulty O-rings.

note.para: If oil entered the fuel system, drain contaminated fuel from tank.

step2.para: Crank engine and record ICP reading.

note.para: If ICP pressure remains low do the following:

svcsubproc.para: 1. Remove fuel transfer pump from the high pressure pump housing.
2. Crank the engine and check for rotation of the fuel transfer pump camshaft inside the housing.
3. If the camshaft is not rotating, remove high pressure pump and tighten drive gear.
4. Reinstall high pressure pump and recheck ICP pressure, while cranking engine.
5. If pressure is low, replace IPR valve and recheck ICP pressure.
6. If pressure is still low, replace high pressure oil pump.

item.para: Oil reservoir leak (possibly through check valve for the high pressure pump)
Pump drive gear loose or damaged
Faulty lube oil pump unable to fill reservoir
Electronic Service Tool (EST) with Master Diagnostics software
ICP adapter fitting from Hydraulic Fitting Kit (ZTSE4359)
See Camshaft Position (CMP) sensor diagnostics in Section 3, Electronic Control System Diagnostics.
